Package org.mitre.synthea.world.concepts

Class BiometricsConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.synthea.world.concepts.BiometricsConfig
  • public abstract class BiometricsConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Class exposing various configurable biometric settings, which are set in resources/biometrics.yml. Unlike the standard "Config" and synthea.properties, it is unlikely that an end-user will want to tweak these often.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static java.lang.Object get​(java.lang.String path)
        Get the object at the given path from the YML. For example, given the following YML:
         foo:
    bar: 2
    baz: 4
    qux:
      corge: 9
      grault: -1
  plugh: 7
        calling get("foo.qux.grault") will return Integer(-1)
        Parameters:
        path - path to the desired object
        Returns:
        the object at path

      • get

        public static java.lang.Object get​(java.lang.String path,
                                   java.lang.Object defaultValue)
        Get the object at the given path from the YML. If not found, returns the default value.
        Parameters:
        path - path to the desired object
        defaultValue - value returned if there is no object at the given path
        Returns:
        the object at path, or defaultValue if not found

      • ints

        public static int[] ints​(java.lang.String path)
        Helper function to get a list of ints from a given location as an array. Note that this function does not convert doubles to integers, so if the YML contains doubles then this method may throw.
        Parameters:
        path - path to the desired object
        Returns:
        parsed integer array

      • doubles

        public static double[] doubles​(java.lang.String path)
        Helper function to get a list of doubles from a given location as an array. This function does convert integers to doubles, so it should be preferred over ints() if the data type is unknown or may change.
        Parameters:
        path - path to the desired object
        Returns:
        parsed double array
